disclaimerText: This forecast is intended to provide information on expected pollution levels in areas of significant public exposure. It may not apply in very specific locations close to unusually strong or short-lived local sources of pollution.

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Saturday 19 March to end of Saturday 19 March GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Saturday will be similar to Friday. dry and sunny with a moderate easterly breeze.<br/><br/>A large high pressure system centred over Scandinavia means we will see easterly airflow on Saturday. <br/>Europe-wide air quality networks are currently showing poor air quality in central Europe. <br/>There is a risk that we will see some import of emissions from central Europe to the UK on Saturday which may be sufficient to move some busy roadside locations into the 'Moderate' threshold for Particulates. <br/>Background locations are expected to remain 'Low' for all other pollutants:<br/><br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/>PM10 Particulates<br/>PM2.5 Particulates<br/><br/><br/>

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Sunday 20 March to end of Sunday 20 March GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Sunday is set to be another dry day with sun and cloud.<br/><br/>By Sunday the high pressure system over northen Europe begins to move further northwards resulting in the easterly airflow becoming more southerly as the day progresses.<br/><br/>This change in airflow should mean any early import from central Europe should drop as we go through the day.<br/><br/>Overall, air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/>PM10 Particulates<br/>PM2.5 Particulates<br/><br/><br/>
